Conures

Green-cheeked Conure

A small, popular conure known for its relatively quiet nature. They are mostly green with a maroon tail, grey head, and subtle red on the belly.

Origin
Central & South America
Size
10 inches (25.5 cm). Weight: 60-80g (2.1-2.8 oz)
Weight
70g avg.
Noise Level
Quiet to Moderate. By far one of the quietest conure species, making them excellent for apartment living.

Looking for a Green-cheeked Conure?

See Available Green-cheeked Conure Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 5/10
Noise Level 5/10
Social Needs 6/10
Cuddliness 9/10

Temperament & Personality

Goofy, affectionate, and intelligent. They are less prone to being nippy than other conures and have big personalities in small bodies.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Can learn some words, but their voices are gravelly and not very clear. They often learn to mimic household sounds.

Dietary Needs

A standard conure diet of pellets, fresh vegetables, and some fruit. Ensure a varied diet to keep them engaged.

Health & Lifespan

Generally robust and can live 15-25 years with proper care. Can be prone to polyomavirus. They love to snuggle in fabric, so be cautious about cloth huts that can cause crop impaction or strangulation.

Housing Requirements

Perfect for apartments. They are relatively quiet and their smaller size means a cage of 20"W x 20"D x 24"H is a good minimum size, though larger is always better.

Common Questions About Green-cheeked Conure

What is the lifespan of a Green-cheeked Conure?

The Green-cheeked Conure typically lives for 15-25 years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Green-cheeked Conure good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'intermediate' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Green-cheeked Conure come from?

The Green-cheeked Conure is native to Central & South America.

More Conures

Dusky Conure

Moderate. While capable of loud calls, they are generally considered to be one of the quieter Aratinga conures.

Gold-Capped Conure

Loud. They have a strong, piercing call and can be quite vocal, especially when they want attention.

Golden Conure

Very Loud. They have a loud, harsh call that they will use frequently, especially if they are not the center of attention.
